args:
My body feels like it's going to split in half.
My eyelids are boulders. All is darkness. Pain.
Still, I suppose dying alone after being consumed
by the power of the seed is a fitting end for me.

I never had any bonds I could believe in.
My father hated me, and I've never even
seen what my mother looked like because
no portraits remain of her.
You can't deny the truth of my words, Albert.\nNot when you have also chosen to betray me.
(He chose to flee. In the end,\nI really am alone...)
(No matter how much power I gained,\nI was always destined for a pitiful end.)
Hold on, Albert! We'll heal you!
No. I'm all right. But even if I wasn't,\nit would be a price well worth paying\nin order to save my friend.
Did you seriously keep holding on to my\nhand? You could have died!
How is it possible to be so foolish?
If that makes me a fool,\nthen I am content with it.
Even if you can no longer believe in me,\nI won't give up on trying to save you.\nI won't leave you—not ever.
How can you still have your head\nso far in the clouds?!

I toyed with you! Betrayed you!
And you STILL call me a friend?!
Oh, it must be wonderful to be
strong enough to feel that way!
What is the source of your power?!\nWhat drives you?!

There is nothing I despise more than the
idea of bonds! Nothing! I lost my mother!
I was loathed from birth by my father!
I have no friends—I HAVE no bonds!
But you do. You are, and will always be,\nthe finest friend I have ever known.
Speaking to you is threatening to split\nmy very mind. It makes me want to\nbelieve in things that cannot be real.
I have come too far to be permitted to\nturn back, and yet the friendship you\ntalk of is... Aaaargh!
Okay, what now!? I thought\nwe stopped all this noise!
Look! The seed is rising out of his body!
Albert's words reached him,\nand because of that...
This is our chance, Albert! Destroy the\ncontrol device AND the seed!
Return my friend to me,\nyou abominable seed!
And with that, the mysterious disappearances\noccurring across the land came to an end.

The seed of the abyss was destroyed,
the people imprisoned within freed,
and with the Halidom's support, they
began to return to their former lives.
I'm shocked by how quickly\nyou recovered from all of this.
It's hard to believe you were unconscious\nfor so long after the seed was destroyed.
I can't deny that was in part due\nto the unrequested devotion\nof a certain someone.
Ha! I was just so happy to have my\nfriend back that I couldn't help myself.
It's good to see everyone getting along.\nEr, but about the tentacles on his body...
A lingering effect of the fusion, I'm afraid.\nThey can be suppressed, but as for fully\nremoving them...
Well, he was simply fused for too long.\nFrankly, it's a miracle he's even alive.
I likely owe my survival to the fact the\ndragonblood within me was weak.
If it was as strong as that of the Alberian\nroyal family, I would have completely\nfused with the seed.
Heh. I have always cursed my weakness,\nbut in the end, it actually saved my life.\nWhat a terribly infuriating thought.
Fear not—I have no intention of saying\nI would rather die than live in shame.
Even if they are not being made public,\nI have committed countless crimes.

Hundreds were consumed by the seed
because of me—and though they all
miraculously survived, that does not
make what I did any less vile.
I have a duty to spend the rest of my days\natoning for these crimes as I can.
Well, I'm glad you've accepted that,\nbut what changed in you?
I decided that I want to try...believing.

All this time, I have been convinced that
I was powerless and insignificant, and so
sought power in an effort to change that
and become someone.
However, this meddling fool risked his life\nto tell me that I already AM someone—\nhis best friend, in point of fact.

Part of me still thinks this to be utter
pablum, but all the same, I've decided
I want to try once more to believe in the
＂bonds＂ he so fervently talks about.
Who knows, maybe they will prove\nanother way to make me stronger!
Besides, I haven't the strength to resist\nany longer even if I wanted to. All that is\nleft is for you to mete out my punishment.
What will you have me do to atone,\nPrince {player_name}?
I think your knowledge—along with what\nremains of the seed's power inside you—\ncan be of great use to us.
I want you to help us.\nThat will be your punishment.
And you truly find that sufficient?
I get that you're trying to say I'm being\nnaive and foolish again—but honestly,\nI'm just glad you're alive.
So as long as you work to atone for what\nyou believe you've done, I'm fine with it.

Simply calling you ＂naive＂ is an
understatement. Your personality
must put your retainers through a
terrific amount of anguish.
Much as our friend's nature causes\nthe Knights of Levin untold trouble.
Regardless, if that is the punishment my\ncaptors have chosen, I will abide by it.
But if I am to be helping you, Prince,\nthere is one thing you should know.
The last of the seeds is currently\nin Prince Phares's possession.
I planned to recover it from him after\nconsuming all of you, but as you see,\nI failed rather spectacularly at that.
Still, it goes without mentioning that it\nis far too dangerous a thing to leave in\nhis possession, so I wish to recover it.
So while helping you, I also intend\nto clean up my past mistakes.\nAre you amenable to that?
Of course, Yurius. Welcome to the team.
I look forward to serving you.
As one of the Knights of Levin,\nI pledge you my undying support,\nPrince {player_name}.
